author: @niteshkumarsharma8305
text: Couldn't agree more to you Krish.! I have been as a data scientist for an year and trust me guys I am learning about software design patterns and other stuffs like that right now! The most important thing that I have learnt is while working is that you should be able explain results of the model, why the model is not performing well?, what are the test samples that it is not able to predict?.  Model building is an iterative process so do don't throw hands if you see poor performance!

author: @johnnyfry2
text: Good advice, I appreciate your passion and I hope new grads listen to this.  As someone with a background in business, sales and work at a large I.T corporation, there is rarely any straight line to a particular career or job.  You will often incorporate all your work and life experience to obtain a career, all experience has value.  Keep your eye on your ultimate goal, but don't corner yourself.
